entry.title: Combined summary - HTLC Endorsement for Jamming Mitigation
entry.summary: The Lightning Network community is engaged in discussions and debates regarding the implementation of reputation systems and HTLC endorsement schemes to address channel jamming attacks. The proposed reputation scheme aims to track reputations locally for each node's peers based on their history with forwarded HTLCs. However, there are concerns about the vulnerability of reputation systems to sudden behavioral changes and whitewashing attacks. It is also debated where reputation systems should sit in the software stack, with suggestions for separate APIs or plugins.The email thread highlights the need for reputational transitivity between incoming and outgoing traffic channels to prevent abuse during high-fee periods. There is a proposal for nodes to allocate slots and liquidity based on reputation, giving priority to endorsed HTLCs from high reputation peers. This reputation-based system is intended to compensate nodes that suffer damage during a channel jamming attack.Data gathering is considered valuable for future simulation work and experimentation with different algorithms for tracking local reputation. Suggestions are made for writing extensions for CLN and using lnmetrics as a platform for experimental data gathering. The differentiation between routing fees and reputation revenue in the HTLC endorsement model is discussed, along with potential issues of gossiping about reputations in a decentralized network.The email thread discusses the vulnerability of large routing nodes to attacks and the impact on smaller nodes during an attack. It is acknowledged that smaller nodes may temporarily compete for scarce liquidity and slots, but they can still interact with similar nodes where they have better chances of building a good reputation. The acquisition cost of local reputation is emphasized, highlighting the need for reputational transitivity between hops in a payment path.A two-part scheme involving HTLC endorsement and reputation is proposed to mitigate channel jamming. The email provides updates on the upcoming call for channel jamming, with the goals of gathering data to observe the effect of endorsement in steady state and experimenting with different algorithms for tracking local reputation. The importance of continuous investment to maintain a good reputation and the limitations of gossiping about reputations are discussed.The email thread also raises concerns about the lack of transitivity in reputation acquisition cost between hops in a payment path. This creates vulnerability issues for the endorsement scheme and synchronization challenges for routing fees among hops. The impact of dynamic reputation windows on payment reliability is also considered.Overall, the Lightning Network community is actively working to improve scalability and transaction speed on the Bitcoin blockchain. The discussions on the Lightning-dev mailing list provide a valuable platform for collaboration and innovation in the field.
